articles.title: TSM Q2 Preview: Double-Digit Earnings Growth in Store?
articles.content: The quarterly report will be watched like a hawk, and for a good reason - TSM supplies chips to many of the tech titans in the market.

articles.title: Why Apple Stock Was a Market-Beater Today
articles.content: Investors are bullish on the company as it advances toward the release of its third-quarter results.

articles.title: The Trade Desk's Deal With Disney May Boost Both Stocks
articles.content: The Trade Desk and Walt Disney will work together to improve ad targeting.

articles.title: Disney (DIS) to Stream BTS' Exclusive Docuseries Next Year
articles.content: Disney (DIS) is all set to bring an exclusive series and shows based on BTS and other new artists from the Hybe Studio to its streaming platform.

articles.title: Mimic Warren Buffett's 2022 Strategy With These 3 Stocks
articles.content: Buffett has been on the offensive throughout 2022, undoubtedly recognizing value in areas amid a volatile backdrop.

articles.title: Why Apple Stock Is Down 17% So Far This Year
articles.content: Investors have been concerned about the company's supply chain problems.

articles.title: Is Duolingo Stock a Buy Now?
articles.content: The language learning app's stock just dropped below its IPO price.

articles.title: 1 FAANG Stock to Buy on the Dip and 1 to Avoid
articles.content: These stocks have fallen sharply in the past year, but one looks too cheap to ignore.

articles.title: Apple stock target cut on downbeat hardware revenue outlook
articles.content: The price target on Apple Inc.'s stock was lowered Tuesday at KeyBanc Capital to below the average target on Wall Street, amid signs suggesting fiscal third-quarter hardware revenue will fall even more than what's already expected.

articles.title: Supply Woes, Weak Demand Cause Deepest Decline in PC Shipments
articles.content: Tepid consumer demand for PCs, lockdowns in China, supply-chain bottlenecks, plus logistics and geopolitical challenges induce the steepest personal computer shipment decline in years, according to Gartner and International Data Corporation.
